column1: She had no powder but found in her grandfather's room a lump of magnesia
column2: which he was in the habit of taking for heartburn
column3: and passed it over and over her brown face and hands. Then a lingering gaze into her small mirror gave her joy at last; she yearned so hard to see herself charming that she did see herself so. Admiration came
column4: and she told herself that she was more attractive to look at than she had ever been in her life
column7: at last she might begin to be sought for like other girls. The little glass showed a sort of prettiness in her thin
column8: unmatured young face; tripping dance tunes ran through her head
column9: her feet keeping the time — ah
column10: she did so hope to dance often that night! Perhaps — perhaps she might be asked for every number. And so
column11: wrapping an old waterproof cloak about her
column12: she took her grandfather's arm and sallied forth
column13: with high hopes in her beating heart.
